lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's was originally named after the Java mascot _Duke_. But has now been given the name Lai. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Lai.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Lai.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
_A rather **cynical** personality that helps you keep track of your life._

> Write it down. Written goals have a way of transforming wishes into wants; cant's into cans; dreams into plans; and plans into reality. Don't just think it - ink it! â€“ Michael Korda [(source)](https://www.azquotes.com/quote/856710)
Lai is currently able to keep track of
- [x] Events (with support for start and end dates)
- [ ] Emotional ramblings (hopefully Lai never has to!)
Adds a to-do task to the list.
Adds a task with a specific deadline to the list.
Adds an event with a start date and an end date to the list.
Added: [E][] library book sharing (from: 02 Jan 2024 to: 04 Jan 2024)
You actually did something? Marked done:
Mark a task as not done.
Come on now, don't be useless. Marked not done:
Shows a list of all the existing tasks in the list.
3. [E][] library book sharing (from: 02 Jan 2024 to: 04 Jan 2024)
Deletes an existing tasks in the list.
Finds all tasks with descriptions that contain the given keyword(s)
1. [E][] library book sharing (from: 02 Jan 2024 to: 04 Jan 2024)

* Represents a deadline, which is a task with an additional due date.
* The due date of the task.
* Constructs a new Deadline with the specified description and due date.
* The due date is parsed from a string and the task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param by The due date of the deadline in ISO-8601 format (e.g., 2023-12-31).
* Constructs a new Deadline with the specified description, initial completion status, and due date.
* If the due date string cannot be parsed in ISO-8601 format, an attempt is made to parse it in "dd MMM yyyy"
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param isDone The initial completion status of the deadline. True if the task is initially done, false otherwise.
* @param by The due date of the deadline. Expected to be in ISO-8601 format, but "dd MMM yyyy" format is attempted
* @throws DateTimeParseException If the due date string cannot be parsed in either ISO-8601 or "dd MMM yyyy"
public Deadline(String description, boolean isDone, String by) {
* Returns a string representation of the deadline, including its type, completion status, description, and due
* @return A string in the format "[D][completion_status] description (by: due_date)", where completion_status is
* "X" if the task is done, or a space character otherwise, and due_date is formatted as "dd MMM yyyy".

* The task is initially marked as not done.

* Returns "X" if the task is done, or a space character otherwise.

return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done task with X
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its completion status and description.

* @return A string in the format "[T][completion_status] description", where completion_status is "X" if the to-do
* item is done, or a space character otherwise.
